results.title: Dance: Videos of Australian dancers and choreographers
results.brief_description: Famous Australian dancers and choreographers give lively and engaging interviews of their fascinating lives in the world of dance. Discover what it was like to be a dancer or choreographer in Australia during the past fifty years.

results.title: Dance with teletubbies
results.creator_credit: BBC, Ragdoll Productions, Anne Wood, Andrew Davenport, Vic Finch and David G. Hillier
results.brief_description: Teletubbies is a TV show that originated on the BBC and has proven to be especially popular among younger children. Tinky Winky, Dipsy, Laa-Laa and Po live in a magical land over the hills and far away, where television comes from - a land where anything can happen. Come and dance with the Teletubbies as they discover how to move their bodies to music!
results.creator_credit_for_label: BBC, Ragdoll Productions, Anne Wood, Andrew Davenport, Vic Finch and David G. Hillier

results.title: Dance with a stranger
results.creator_credit: First Film Company, Roger Randall-Cutler and Mike Newell
results.brief_description: The story of Ruth Ellis, a woman tortured by her love for a cruel man who demanded and took from her more than she could possibly give. Her only escape was to rid herself of the terrible pain he caused, so she shot him dead in cold blood. She was convicted of murder and became the last woman in England to be hanged. Starring Miranda Richardson, Rupert Everett and Ian Holm.

results.title: Dance trip
results.brief_description: Describes the immigration of Filipinos to Hawaii and their lives, history and accomplishments there; recounts Philippine-United States relationships through old film clips. Presents many Filipino folk dances as danced by the Bailes de Jose.

results.title: Dance squared = Ronde carree
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Frank Spiller and Rene Jodoin
results.brief_description: This film is an encounter with geometrical shapes which children can readily understand and enjoy. As the title suggests “Dance Squared” employs movement, colour and music to explore the symmetries of the square. Every movement of the square and its components presents an opportunity to observe its geometrical properties in a way that is intriguing to young minds. With basic concepts firmly grasped, the young student is then prepared to experiment on his own. No dialogue, set to square dance music, suitable for all ages. (Five awards, including Chicago and Toronto.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Frank Spiller and Rene Jodoin

results.title: Dance on a May Day
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America and John G. Avildsen
results.brief_description: Focuses on professional dancer Jacques d’Amboise, who founded the National Dance Institute for the purpose of introducing dance to boys. Observes d’Amboise and his students in practice sessions, as well as in performance at New York’s Lincoln Center.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Learning Corporation of America and John G. Avildsen

results.title: Dance of the wind = Wara Mandel
results.creator_credit: Pandora Filmproduktion, Elephant Eye, Illuminations Films, JBA, Karl Baumgartner and Rajan Khosa
results.brief_description: Pallavi is the daughter of a renowned Indian singer who is continuing in her mother’s footsteps as a classical singer, concert performer and teacher. After the death of her mother, she is saddened and loses her confidence and ability to perform. She develops a friendship with an elusive street urchin with a beautiful singing voice, and embarks on a journey of self-discovery and healing. An award winning film by Rajan Khosa which captures the beauty of Indian classical music. Cast includes Kitu Gidwani, Bhaveen Gosain and B.C. Sanyal. In Hindi and English with English subtitles.

results.title: Dance of the shells = Tanz der muscheln
results.brief_description: The many shaped and many textured world of shells from all over the oceans is observed under changing lights and in varied patterns of movement. The accompanying music is composed of electronically produced sound. Beautifully photographed and dramatically lit - a very striking film.
results.title_for_label: Dance of the shells = Tanz der muscheln

results.title: Dance of death
results.brief_description: A young girl, Sally Roberts, transfixed by the violence portrayed on TV enthusiastically tunes into the ‘Dance of Death’, a TV game show. The ‘Dance of Death’ hosted by ‘The Smiling Scull’ is a show where the willing contestants compete to kill themselves in the most imaginative way possible. Turning back on TV for it’s content the animation uses TV in this black comedy to critique the role of TV and effect it has on shaping our culture - with a focus on how too much violence desensitises it’s audience allowing the audience to consent to their own victimisation. (Award: Best non-feature animation 1983 AFI Awards)
